subject: Relationships
title: The Erosion of Self-Worth
description: A 60-second lesson on The Erosion of Self-Worth.

hook.text: Before the relationship, she was confident and ambitious. Three years later, she apologizes for breathing too loudly.

buildup.text: Toxic relationships erode self-worth gradually. Daily criticism becomes internalized as truth over months and years.

discovery.text: Psychologists call it 'introjection' â€” absorbing the abuser's negative view of you until it becomes your own voice.

twist.text: After leaving, survivors often can't accept compliments. The abuser's voice persists long after the relationship ends.

climax.text: Rebuilding self-worth after toxic love isn't vanity â€” it's rehabilitation. You're recovering a self that was stolen.

punchline.text: Toxic love steals your self-worth. Recovery means reclaiming who you were.

quiz.question: What is 'introjection' in the context of toxic relationships?
options: Absorbing the abuser's view until it becomes your inner voice
